SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.mapping

Interface WritingMapper<M extends WritingMapper<M>>

Type Parameters:
M - The concrete type that extends WritingMapper, enabling fluent method chaining.
All Superinterfaces:
Mapper
All Known Subinterfaces:
ObjectElementMapper, ObjectMapper, ObjectMapper
All Known Implementing Classes:
ObjectElementMapperImpl
public interface WritingMapper<M extends WritingMapper<M>> extends Mapper
Interface for configuring and managing the serialization mappings of Java objects.

The WritingMapper interface extends the Mapper interface and provides mechanisms to bind and unbind target types, register custom type adapters, and manage type resolution for serialization purposes. It is designed to support a fluent API, allowing method chaining for configuration.

Key Features:

  • Binding and unbinding of target Java types for serialization.
  • Registration and management of custom TypeAdapters for specific types.
  • Retrieval of a WritingInvoker to handle field writing operations.
  • Provision of a forward caller function for type conversions during serialization.
  • Access to a TypeResolver for resolving generic types during serialization.

Generic Parameters:

  • M: The concrete type that extends WritingMapper. This enables method chaining by ensuring that methods return the appropriate subtype.

Example Usage:


 // Instantiate a WritingMapper implementation
 WritingMapper<MyWritingMapper> mapper = new MyWritingMapperImpl();

 // Bind a target type for serialization
 mapper.bindTo(MyClass.class)
       .withTypeAdapter(MyClass.class, new MyClassTypeAdapter())
       .withTypeAdapters(Map.of(
           String.class, new StringTypeAdapter(),
           Integer.class, new IntegerTypeAdapter()
       ));

 // Unbind a target type
 mapper.unbind(MyClass.class);

 // Serialize an object to JSONObject
 MyClass myObject = new MyClass(...);
 JSONObject jsonObject = mapper.toJSONObject(myObject, MappingContext.getDefault());
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • bindTo

      @NotNull M bindTo(@NotNull @NotNull Class<?> targetType)
      Binds a specific Java class type to the mapper for serialization.

      Binding a class type informs the mapper that instances of this type should be considered during the serialization process. This is essential for registering types that the mapper needs to handle explicitly.

      Parameters:
      targetType - The Java class type to bind for serialization.
      Returns:
      The current instance of M for method chaining.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if targetType is null.

    • unbind

      @NotNull M unbind(@NotNull @NotNull Class<?> targetType)
      Unbinds a specific Java class type from the mapper, preventing its instances from being serialized.

      Unbinding a class type removes it from the mapper's consideration during the serialization process. This is useful for excluding certain types from serialization.

      Parameters:
      targetType - The Java class type to unbind from serialization.
      Returns:
      The current instance of M for method chaining.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if targetType is null.

    • unbindAll

      @NotNull M unbindAll()
      Unbinds all previously bound Java class types from the mapper.

      This method clears all type bindings, ensuring that no Java class types are considered during the serialization process. It effectively resets the mapper's type binding configuration.

      Returns:
      The current instance of M for method chaining.

    • bindTo

      default WritingMapper<M> bindTo(@NotNull @NotNull Class<?>[] targetTypes)
      Binds multiple Java class types to the mapper for serialization.

      This convenience method allows binding an array of class types in a single call, enhancing configurability and reducing repetitive code.

      Parameters:
      targetTypes - An array of Java class types to bind for serialization.
      Returns:
      The current instance of M for method chaining.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if targetTypes is null or contains null elements.

    • bindTo

      default WritingMapper<M> bindTo(@NotNull @NotNull Set<Class<?>> targetTypes)
      Binds multiple Java class types to the mapper for serialization.

      This convenience method allows binding a set of class types in a single call, enhancing configurability and reducing repetitive code.

      Parameters:
      targetTypes - A set of Java class types to bind for serialization.
      Returns:
      The current instance of M for method chaining.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if targetTypes is null or contains null elements.

    • getWritingInvoker

      @NotNull @NotNull WritingInvoker getWritingInvoker()
      Retrieves the WritingInvoker responsible for handling field writing operations.

      The WritingInvoker facilitates the invocation of field setters or direct field access during the serialization process. It abstracts the details of how fields are written to the resulting JSON structure.

      Returns:
      The WritingInvoker instance used for field writing operations.

    • getForwardCaller

      @NotNull @NotNull BiFunction<Object,Type,Object> getForwardCaller()
      Retrieves the forward caller function used for type conversions during serialization.

      The BiFunction returned by this method is used to convert objects from one type to another during the serialization process. It takes an Object as input and the target Type, then returns an instance of the target type.

      Returns:
      A BiFunction that performs type conversions, taking an Object and a target Type, and returning an instance of the target type.

    • findTypeAdapter

      @Nullable <T> @Nullable TypeAdapter<T> findTypeAdapter(@NotNull @NotNull Class<T> type)
      Finds a registered TypeAdapter for the specified Java class type.

      This method searches for a TypeAdapter that has been registered for the given class type. A TypeAdapter defines how instances of a particular type are serialized into JSON.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the Java class for which the TypeAdapter is sought.
      Parameters:
      type - The Java class type for which to find the TypeAdapter.
      Returns:
      The TypeAdapter associated with the specified type, or null if none is found.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.

    • withTypeAdapter

      @NotNull <T> M withTypeAdapter(@NotNull @NotNull Class<T> type, @NotNull @NotNull TypeAdapter<? extends T> adapter)
      Registers a TypeAdapter for the specified Java class type.

      This method associates a TypeAdapter with a particular Java class type, enabling customized serialization behavior for that type. If a TypeAdapter was previously registered for the given type, it will be replaced by the new adapter.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the Java class for which the TypeAdapter is being registered.
      Parameters:
      type - The Java class type to associate with the TypeAdapter.
      adapter - The TypeAdapter to register for the specified type.
      Returns:
      The current instance of M for method chaining.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type or adapter is null.

    • withTypeAdapters

      @NotNull M withTypeAdapters(@NotNull @NotNull Map<Class<?>,@NotNull TypeAdapter<?>> adapters)
      Registers multiple TypeAdapters for their respective Java class types.

      This method allows bulk registration of TypeAdapters by providing a map where each key is a Java class type and the corresponding value is the TypeAdapter for that type. Existing TypeAdapters for any of the specified types will be replaced.

      Parameters:
      adapters - A map containing Java class types as keys and their corresponding TypeAdapters as values.
      Returns:
      The current instance of M for method chaining.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if adapters is null or contains null keys or values.

    • clearTypeAdapters

      @NotNull M clearTypeAdapters()
      Clears all registered TypeAdapters from the mapper.

      After invoking this method, no TypeAdapters will be registered, and the mapper will revert to its default serialization behavior for all types.

      Returns:
      The current instance of M for method chaining.

    • getTypeResolver

      @NotNull @NotNull TypeResolver getTypeResolver()
      Retrieves the TypeResolver responsible for resolving generic types during serialization.

      The TypeResolver is utilized to handle the resolution of generic type parameters, ensuring that the correct type information is available during the serialization process.

      Returns:
      The TypeResolver instance used for resolving generic types.
